contents.item: Wise men don't feel companionless when they are not in the company of their egos.
contents.owner: Delian Zahariev

contents.item: Pure joy is rare. That’s why for every meal I eat a really bloody steak.
contents.owner: Bauvard, Some Inspiration for the Overenthusiastic

contents.item: When would he learn that women never stayed where you put them?
contents.owner: Maya Banks, Hidden Away

contents.item: If I looked like him,” Tara said. “I’d want to have sex with myself. All the time.
contents.owner: Jill Shalvis, Simply Irresistible

contents.item: No need, no, need. Life is already too short to find it.
contents.owner: Jessica Day George, Princess of the Midnight Ball

contents.item: No bikinis on a first date.” He nods. “I’m sure that’s a rule. Or should be. For my sisters anyway.
contents.owner: Huntley Fitzpatrick, My Life Next Door

contents.item: I guess I like things that take time and attention. More worthwhile that way.
contents.owner: Huntley Fitzpatrick, My Life Next Door

contents.item: This is Sailor Supergirl,” George says. “She knows all about black holes.
contents.owner: Huntley Fitzpatrick, My Life Next Door

contents.item: Right. Because if you have trouble putting ketchup and mustard on a hot dog, you should totally move on to saving lives.
contents.owner: Huntley Fitzpatrick, My Life Next Door

contents.item: When I turn back to Jase, he’s again beaming at me. “You’re nice.” He sounds pleased, as if he hadn’t expected this aspect of my personality.
contents.owner: Huntley Fitzpatrick, My Life Next Door

contents.item: When they’re together, the world could fall apart around them and they’d never notice or care as long as they have each other.
contents.owner: Simone Elkeles, Rules of Attraction

contents.item: Jase props himself up on an elbow, looking at me for a minute without saying anything. His face gets an unreadable expression, and I wish I could take back walking over.Then he observes, “I’m guessing that’s a uniform.”Crap. I’d forgotten I was still wearing it.
contents.owner: Huntley Fitzpatrick, My Life Next Door

contents.item: You realise you’re going to owe me dinner after this, right?”“How does McDonald’s sound?”“Inadequate.
contents.owner: Sarah Mayberry, Her Best Friend

contents.item: When you sit that way, you look kind of like a beach ball with a head,” he continued. “Your haircut is really, really bad, I’m probably going to lose my job for helping you this way, and I’m dying to fuck you.” He glanced at her. “That honest enough for you?
contents.owner: Suzanne Brockmann, Bodyguard

contents.item: She has to agree to have me. It could take some time, but I’m confident I can trick her into it.
contents.owner: Robyn Carr, Promise Canyon

contents.item: Excuse me?" I said, palms down on the Formica tabletop. "Coffee? I thought we came here for pie." "I don't eat the kind of pie they serve here." I felt a flash of heat go through my stomach. I knew firsthand the kind of pie Ranger liked.
contents.owner: Janet Evanovich, To the Nines

contents.item: Sophie, honey, stop looking at me like that,” Garrett said gruffly. “You’ll have me convinced I’m going to die.”“You’re not?
contents.owner: Maya Banks, No Place to Run

contents.item: Who’s there?”“The scratcher of your itch,” he said.She opened the door a crack and stuck her nose out. “Was that supposed to be romantic?
contents.owner: Jill Shalvis, Instant Attraction

contents.item: Sarah, honey, I hardly think kidnappers are going to take the time to buy a memento of their stay. I could be wrong, but it seems rather unlikely.
contents.owner: Christine Feehan, Magic in the Wind

contents.item: He needed to gather her up, hold on to her, anything to help her stop trembling. Something was going to shake loose if she didn’t.
contents.owner: Tara Janzen, Crazy Sweet
